comments:
Just performing a normal string search through several Java projects in my workspace. Tried several things to remedy this bug (including a fresh install with reinstalled plugins), but no dice.

This is a known bug, but I haven't been able to reproduce it.  If you can provide any steps to reproduce it would be greatly appreciated.

*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 144499 ***

I've managed to fix this problem by editting my .classpath file manually and reimporting the project into my workspace. In my case, it appears that it was something to do with a non-source file in my project that once removed resolved itself. I had to remove it 'by hand' though, since trying to delete it from the IDE didn't work (same error as below).

> In my case, it appears that it was something to do with a non-source 
> file in my project that once removed resolved itself.

Was it a linked file, or was it physically located on disk below its parent folder?  How did you remove the offending file - by deleting on disk and then refreshing the workspace?

It was physically located below parent folder. The first thing I tried was to manually edit the exclusion filter in the .classpath file to ignore the whole folder (I said 'file' before... I meant 'folder') and then refreshed the project, but that didn't work. I then removed the project and re-imported it, and that did the trick.
